CARDINAL . In assessing the evidence for the purpose of establishing the facts , the ORG considers that the following elements are relevant .

( i ) In assessing both written and oral evidence , the ORG has hitherto generally applied “ beyond a reasonable doubt ” as the standard of proof required . Such proof may follow from the coexistence of sufficiently strong , clear and concordant inferences or of similar unrebutted presumptions of fact ; in addition , the conduct of the parties in relation to the ORG 's efforts to obtain evidence may constitute an element to be taken into account ( see , mutatis mutandis , GPE v. the GPE , judgment of DATE , Series A no .
